explanation: The report is correct. In the shown translation unit ret is initialized to -1 and, under the scenario where the conditional compilation removes the code that might modify ret, nothing changes that value before the repeated tests of 0 >= ret. That makes the controlling expressions of those if statements effectively invariant (always true) in that build. MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 prohibits invariant controlling expressions (the only listed exceptions are for infinite loops and the special do-while case, neither of which applies here). Consequently a static analysis of the translation unit in such a configuration would correctly report a Rule 14.3 violation. (Mitigations include restructuring the conditional compilation to remove the redundant ifs, delaying initialization, or guarding the whole if-chain with the same preprocessor conditions.)
